title: Biden's energy transition subsidies spark national jubilation for the business community
description: The Democratic administration has chosen to pour over $420 billion into its economy to Americanize the green transition and the microprocessor industry.

title: Trump makes his first posts on reinstated Facebook and Youtube accounts
description: The former US president was sanctioned for posting content that the platforms said incited unrest, with YouTube announcing his reinstatement on Friday, two months after Facebook said it was unlocking his account.

title: Lance Reddick, star of 'The Wire', is dead at 60
description: Reddick rose to prominence in 2000 on the HBO prison drama 'Oz', but it was for his role on 'The Wire' that he became best known.

title: In China, women are excluded from the upper echelons of power
description: For the first time in 20 years, there are no women among the 24 members of the CCP's political bureau or among the vice-premiers.

title: Berlin holds unprecedented demonstration against Netanyahu's government
description: Conservative German Jews protested alongside left-leaning and even pro-Palestinian Jews at the Brandenburg Gate.

title: Former presidents Sarkozy and Hollande clash again on nuclear energy
description: Emmanuel Macron's two most recent predecessors were heard one after the other by a parliamentary inquiry on nuclear energy in France.

title: After Poland, Slovakia to give Ukraine Soviet-era MiG-29 jets
description: The central european country becomes the second NATO member country to bolster Ukraine's existing MiG-29 fleet with its 13 planes, following Zelenskyy's pleas.

title: Sweden lowers its targets for development aid
description: Under pressure from the far-right and conservatives, the government is breaking with the goals set 60 years ago, causing confusion and concern among NGOs who are seeing their budgets shrink.

title: ICC issues arrest warrant for Putin over alleged Ukraine war crimes
description: The International Criminal Court said on Thursday there were 'reasonable grounds' to believe that Russia's president was responsible for the deportation of children from Ukraine to Russia.

title: EU presents unprecedented industrial policy in response to Biden's investment plan
description: The European Commission presented on Thursday a plan designed to build and subsidize zero-emission European manufacturing.

title: After the pension fiasco, Macron leaves PM Borne in the firing line
description: The executive duo decided to use Article 49.3 of the Constitution to force the reform through Parliament without a vote. The prime minister said she is ready to bear the brunt of this unpopular decision.

title: French pension reform: MPs file no-confidence motions against government
description: Left-wing lawmakers also filed a request for a referendum on the reform, which would require 5 million signatures before a vote could be organized.

title: First Republic Bank shares slump, affecting US stocks
description: US and European stock markets fell on Friday as fears over the health of the banking system festered despite the latest efforts to shore up troubled lenders and tamp down contagion risks.

title: Italy's far-right prime minister addresses country's oldest union
description: Greeted with a chorus of protests, Giorgia Meloni managed to command complete silence for her speech in front of the country's most left-wing union.

title: Cyclone Freddy adds to Malawi's mountain of woe
description: At a time when the country is already experiencing a health and social crisis, Cyclone Freddy, whose trajectory and longevity are exceptional, has caused more than 300 deaths and severe destruction.

title: French pension reform: Macron's decision to bypass Parliament ignites fear of 'social explosion'
description: Spontaneous rallies took place all over France on Thursday after the government passed its pension reform bill 'by force'.

title: French pension reform: A case study of what not to do in politics
description: French President Emmanuel Macron's decision to push through his reform without a vote in the Assemblée Nationale could fuel protests with the risk of violent outbursts.

title: French pension reform: Bypassing Parliament one time too many
description: If France enters a new fit of anger or vengeful strikes, the government will only have itself to blame.

title: Despite banking crisis, European Central Bank raises interest rates
description: The mini-financial crisis of the last few days has not deterred the ECB from raising its interest rate.

title: French pension reform: A day of drama at the Assemblée
description: The French government opted to force the pension reform bill through the Assemblée Nationale without a vote, using a special procedure. Fury from lawmakers ensued.

title: Poland will be the first NATO country to deliver fighter jets to Ukraine
description: Warsaw has promised to send four MiG-29 fighter bombers to Kyiv in the next few days. It could be followed, at first, by Central and Eastern European countries.

title: Macron says 'financial risks too great' not to pass pension reform
description: The French president justified the contested decision to bypass a parliament vote by insisting the risks of 'bankruptcy' make the reform too crucial to fail.

title: Chinese leader Xi to visit Moscow in apparent show of support for Putin
description: According to the Kremlin, they will discuss further developing their comprehensive partnership in the context of deepening cooperation in the international arena.

title: French pension reform: Macron's isolation revealed by recourse to Article 49.3
description: Fearing that his bill would be rejected, the French president decided to bypass a high-risk vote in the Assemblée Nationale on Thursday by using a special provision in the Constitution.

title: NASA unveils new spacesuit for future moon missions
description: Designed by the company Axiom Space, the suit, equipped with a lighting system and a high definition camera, will be worn by the next Americans to walk on the Moon.

title: Series Mania Festival: An international showcase of TV series beyond American dominance
description: Americans are back in force in Lille for the 13th edition of Series Mania, but the festival is more international than ever.

title: After Turkey quake, reeling city of Kahramanmaras questions political choices
description: A historic stronghold of Recep Tayyip Erdogan's party, the city of 1.2 million inhabitants was just 10 kilometers from the epicenter of the earthquake that tore it apart on February 6.

title: Pension reform: 'A high employment rate for older workers does not prevent a low unemployment rate for young people'
description: An increase in retirement age will not lead to youth unemployment but it will require improving education and training throughout the life cycle, explains economist Stéphane Hamayon in an article for 'Le Monde.'

title: The US Federal Reserve lends $12 billion to US banks
description: The Fed had unveiled the scheme on Sunday night, as authorities looked to prevent other banks from running into the liquidity issues that ultimately doomed California's SVB.

title: California plans to transform prison with death row legacy, with emphasis on rehab
description: The plan marks a massive shift in how the state would shape the fates of those behind bars.
